definition: matchmaking/abbr. for 婚姻介紹|婚姻介绍

sentences.english: Detective Barton : And yet, you got engaged to the man who murdered your husband.
sentences.chinese: 不一定，你曾經和謀殺你丈夫的人定了婚。

sentences.english: The beautiful topiary trees are witnesses of our marriage.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫鮮花柱見證我們的婚盟約誓。

sentences.english: Perhaps sotsukon is the ultimate climax of that individualization.
sentences.chinese: 也許“卒婚”是這種個性化的終極表現。

sentences.english: It soon came out that Peter and Alice going to get married.
sentences.chinese: 布久刁家知道撂彼得和艾麗坦將要踞婚的消孝。

sentences.english: “He’s probably going to propose,” Nadja said.
sentences.chinese: “他很可能要求婚了，”娜迪亞說。

sentences.english: Mr. Darcy is engaged to my daughter.
sentences.chinese: 達西先生早跟我的女兒訂過婚了。

sentences.english: Soon they fell in love, and were betrothed to be married.
sentences.chinese: 他們很快墜入了愛河，不久就訂了婚。

sentences.english: Darcy is engaged to my daughter. Now what have you to say?
sentences.chinese: 達西先生早跟我的女兒訂過婚了。

sentences.english: Glen and Lorraine just celebrated their diamond anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 格倫和洛蘭剛剛慶祝了他們的鑽石婚紀念日。

sentences.english: “He’s probably going to propose, ” Nadja said.
sentences.chinese: “他很可能要求婚了，”娜迪亞說。

sentences.english: They're standing on a wedding car.
Another proverb about love is: "Absence makes the heart grow fonder."
sentences.chinese: “小別勝新婚”是另一條有關愛的諺語。

sentences.english: He wooed four girls before finally marrying one.
sentences.chinese: 他在結婚之前曾向四個姑娘求過婚。

sentences.english: Uncle Mike married twice, he has two stepsons.
sentences.chinese: Mike舅舅結過兩次婚，他有2個繼子。

sentences.english: His daughter was betrothed to a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他的女兒同一個教師訂了婚。

definition: to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
to get married soon after meeting (abbr. for 閃電結婚|闪电结婚[shan3 dian4 jie2 hun1]) (neologism c. 2005)
to give birth to a child or children
variant of 訂婚|订婚[ding4 hun1]
sham marriage, esp. a marriage between a gay man and a lesbian arranged in response to parental expectations of a conventional marriage/abbr. for 形式婚姻
to break a promise of marriage
